name: Your Number's Up!  Movie Title Numbers Quiz | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of the following titles fits the movie in which a statue comes to life and falls for a window dresser?
questions.explanation:
One Touch of Venus.

	Ava Gardner, Robert Walker and Eve Arden starred in this 1948 satirical comedy from Universal which had first been written for Broadway by S.J. Perelman and Ogden Nash.

questions.text: Who starred with Clint Eastwood in "Two Mules for Sister Sarah"?
questions.explanation:
Shirley Maclaine.

	Shirley Maclaine plays a woman rescued from rape by the wandering cowboy character of Eastwood. Pretty soon it is obvious that she is not really a nun and has other devious plans in mind. This all leads to a very violent climax.

questions.text: In John Ford's western "Three Godfathers" the three men in question were played by John Wayne, Pedro Armendariz and which other actor?
questions.explanation:
Harry Carey Junior.

	This is the classic story of how three outlaws escaping across a desert gradually take on the responsibility for an orphaned baby. It was made on several other occasions under different titles including a television movie called "The Godchild" and starring Jack Palance.

questions.text: "The Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse" was a silent movie based on the novel by Vicente Blasco Ibanez. Which actor did it turn into a star?
questions.explanation:
Rudolph Valentino.

	It is all about how a young Argentinian fights for his father's country, France, during World War I. It was remade during the 1960s with Glenn Ford. This time the action was updated to World War 2 and the young man joined the French Resistance.

questions.text: Which of the following titles fits the movie where a girl with secret information from her scientist brother has a mental breakdown as well as being chased by a group of spies?
questions.explanation:
Five Steps to Danger.

	The movie in question starred Sterling Hayden and Ruth Roman. "Five Easy Pieces" was the one where Jack Nicholson played a drifter from a middle-class background. "Five Graves to Cairo" is a war film directed by Billy Wilder and "Five Fingers" was where the valet stole the military secrets and passed them on to the Germans.

questions.text: What was the name of the movie starring Dudley Moore and Mary Tyler Moore about a dying ten year old girl?
questions.explanation:
Six Weeks.

	He is a politician and she is a wealthy cosmetics tycoon. It is a genuine "weepie".  Perhaps we should mention that Dudley Moore once starred in another more light-hearted number movie called "10" where the object of his fascination was Bo Derek.

questions.text: Everyone remembers who were "The Magnificent Seven". There was Steve McQueen, Yul Brynner, Charles Bronson, Horst Buchholz, Robert Vaughan, James Coburn and which other actor?
questions.explanation:
Brad Dexter.

	Robert Fuller appeared in "The Return of the Seven". Eli Wallach was in "The Magnificent Seven" but he played the Mexican bandit chief. Lee Van Cleef starred in "The Magnificent Seven Ride".

questions.text: Which is the correct description of the movie "Eight O'Clock Walk"?
questions.correct: A barrister proves a taxi driver innocent of murder.
options: A wartime pilot helps his buddy recover his nerve for combat.
A young doctor finds trouble in a north country village.
A nazi commandant loses his sanity over wartime escapes.
questions.explanation:
A barrister proves a taxi driver innocent of murder.

	The "eight o'clock walk" is the walk that the condemned man must take to the scaffold in the days when the British had the death penalty. Richard Attenborough and Derek Farr starred in this court-room drama.

questions.text: Which actor plays the part of the sleazy boss in the movie "Nine to Five"?
questions.explanation:
Dabney Coleman.

	Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton and Lily Tomlin join together in a plot to dispose of their boss. Poison is involved but things do not work out in quite the way the women intended.

questions.text: Who played the part of Christie, the murderer, in "Ten Rillington Place" which was based on the reconstruction of a notorious series of murders in London?
questions.explanation:
Richard Attenborough.

	The script was based on the book by Ludovic Kennedy who tried to bring out clearly the miscarriage of justice in the case of Timothy Evans. It was one of the causes celebres which led to the eventual abolition of the death penalty in the United Kingdom.
